intro: Draba sierrae, commonly known as Sierra Draba, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine habitats and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Draba sierrae is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and short, flowering stems. It is a rare and endemic species, adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its high-altitude habitat.
